text: how can I find the "latest_value" and past it to the "latest_campaign_tag_hs_test" field?

Hello everyone!

I need to preface my message by saying that I am just now starting out my journey into the world of HubSpot API and custom coded action, so my question might be quite simple :slightly_smiling_face:.

I am trying to copy a custom coded action output to a date property in HubSpot, but I am unsure about which is the correct format that I need to give the output, both in terms of data type and also in actual value formatting.

Currently, I tried setting the output to a string, and the actual value to UNIX timestamp in milliseconds (looking something like this: ‘createdate_tradeshow’: 1731511234082). This, though, still result in an error while I try to copy the value to a date property.

Any help is appreciated!
Hey <@U079QHR5345> :wave:  there's a bit to unpack here, I'll pick this up with you in DMs.

Hi <@U07TJ2Z66LA> :wave:
What are the _type_ and _fieldType_ attributes of your property, *createdate_tradeshow*? You should be able to retrieve this from <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/properties|HubSpot's Properties API> > "Read a property"
If it's "date" and "date" (which I suspect it might be), then this kind of property can only accept timestamps that are equal to midnight (GMT) on the date in question.
